title: Man Utd's seven-man transfer shortlist as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer looks to rebuild
text:

Manchester United are reportedly targeting seven players as they look to bolster the squad following their dreadful start to the season.

Despite beating Chelsea 4-0 on the first game of the season United's form has been on the decline ever since, and they have recorded just one win in their last five matches, with that being a penalty shootout victory over Rochdale in the Carabao Cup.

This awful run has heaped the pressure on manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, but the board are thought to be behind the Norwegian manager, and want to help him out as best they can by splashing the cash in January.

(Image: SIMONE ARVEDA/EPA-EFE/REX)

According to ESPN the seven players United are interested in are Mario Mandzukic, John McGinn, James Maddison, Callum Wilson, Declan Rice, Moussa Dembele and Ivan Rakitic.

Much of United's troubles have come as a result of their inability to score goals, and they have hit the back of the net just twice in their last five games in all competitions.

Mandzukic, Wilson or Dembele could go a long way towards filling the void left by the departure of striker Romelu Lukaku over the summer, and United are thought to be monitoring the situation of all of them.

They are also lacking a ball-playing midfielder, which is where Maddison or McGinn could prove to be great assets, although it is not known if their respective clubs, Leicester and Aston Villa, would be willing to let them go.

(Image: Getty Images)

Finally, either Rice or Rakitic are also being targeted in the defensive midfielder role, with 2018 signing Fred still failing to inspire at Old Trafford.

Solskjaer will no doubt be hoping he can survive until January so he can work with some new players. The fixtures do not get any easier for him, with United hosting bitter rivals Liverpool on Sunday looking to end their 100 per cent start to the season.
description: The club are looking for an overhaul of the squad following a woeful start to the season which sees United in 12th place after eight games
